[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Cross-contract event safety] Can events created by one contract be maliciously crafted to appear as if they originated from a different contract when consumed by event listeners? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Type parameter deserialization] When events with generic type parameters are deserialized, can type parameter values be manipulated to cause deserialization into wrong types? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Anyhow error chaining] Does the anyhow::Result error type properly chain errors from bcs and ContractEvent? Can error context be lost, making debugging attacks harder? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Event type registry] Is there a central registry of valid event types? Can unregistered types emit events that bypass monitoring, auditing, or filtering systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Module address validation] Does struct_tag() validate that the module address matches the actual deployed module address? Can address spoofing allow events to falsely claim origin from trusted modules? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [BCS max size] If BCS has a maximum serialization size, can types that exceed this limit cause truncation or errors that are not properly handled? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Phantom type parameters] Can types with PhantomData fields abuse phantom type parameters in struct_tag() to create type confusion without affecting serialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Integer overflow in size calc] When ContractEvent::new_v2() calculates event size by adding bcs::serialized_size(&type_tag) + event_data.len(), can integer overflow occur for extremely large events? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Type tag malleability] Can the same logical type be represented by different TypeTag values (e.g., with equivalent but differently ordered type arguments) causing event deduplication issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Implementation consistency] If a type's MoveStructType implementation is changed (e.g., via module upgrade), can old events with outdated struct_tag values cause deserialization failures or security issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Serialization canonicalization] Does BCS enforce canonical encoding? Can non-canonical encodings bypass validation or cause different nodes to produce different event hashes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Type tag equality] When comparing TypeTag values for event filtering, does equality checking handle all edge cases (e.g., equivalent but differently represented type arguments)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Event emission authorization] Is there any authorization check before create_event_v2() allows event creation? Can unauthorized code emit privileged events? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Type parameter lifetime] If struct_tag() returns type parameters with specific lifetimes, can lifetime mismatches cause memory safety issues when constructing TypeTag::Struct? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Event data tampering] After bcs::to_bytes() produces event_data, is there any possibility for the data to be tampered with before being wrapped in ContractEvent::new_v2()? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Multiple trait implementations] Can a type implement MoveEventV2Type multiple times with different constraints, causing ambiguity in which implementation is used? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Hash collision via type tag] Can attackers craft different StructTag values that hash to the same value, causing event misclassification in hash-based indexing systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Struct tag immutability] After struct_tag() is called and boxed, is the StructTag immutable? Can mutable references to the boxed value allow post-creation tampering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Event schema evolution] If a type's structure changes but its struct_tag() remains the same, can old events be incorrectly deserialized into new type versions causing data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Type tag depth limits] Does TypeTag construction enforce depth limits on nested type arguments? Can excessively deep type hierarchies cause stack overflow or performance issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/move_utils/move_event_v2.rs] [Function: create_event_v2()] [Serialization atomicity] Is the serialization in bcs::to_bytes() atomic? Can concurrent modifications to shared state during serialization cause non-deterministic event data? (Critical)
